raw_mentions:
B02C 11 binds to FVIII with an apparent dissociation constant K<sub>D</sub> ~ 2xl0<sup>"u</sup> mol L<sup>"1</sup> 
The dynamic range for the SPR assay was narrow, with a range of quantification from 0.2 μg/ml (~1 nM) to 5 μg/ml (-33 nM). 
The spike-recovery experiment with 1.0 μg/ml (~7 nM) B02C11 demonstrated a recovery of 109±16% (Figure IB). 
The dynamic range of the SPR assay was from 0.2-33 μg/ml anti-FVIII antibody, corresponding to -1.4-35 BU/ml for the high-affinity neutralizing monoclonal antibody B02C11 (Figure 1A). 
Below 0.2 μg/ml, signal to noise ratios were too low to obtain reliable information. 
these spike-recovery assays indicated the lower limit for detection of this high-affinity neutralizing antibody by SPR was 0.2 μg/ml~1.4 BU/ml.
